Please select Please identify your race Please select Race & Ethnicity Definitions If you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below, please indicate by making the appropriate selection. As a government contractor subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected categories is as follows: A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service. An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense. An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985. You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to: * Autism * Autoimmune disorder, for example, lupus, fibromyalgia, rheumatoid arthritis, or HIV/AIDS * Blind or low vision * Cancer * Cardiovascular or heart disease * Celiac disease * Cerebral palsy * Deaf or hard of hearing * Depression or anxiety * Diabetes * Epilepsy * Gastrointestinal disorders, for example, Crohn's Disease, or irritable bowel syndrome * Intellectual disability * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs * Nervous system condition for example, migraine headaches, Parkinsons disease, or Multiple sclerosis (MS) * Psychiatric condition, for example, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, PTSD, or major depression Disability Status Please select 1Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. position: Work with the award winning Content Writing Intership
description:
Here is what you will receive at the end of the internship:

A full online portfolio
A letter of recommendation
A certificate of graduation for Linkedin
Our team will help you land the job of your dreams
Enough writing experience to show to potential employers

Here at Furzly, we understand that breaking into writing can be “ruff”. Whether you are a new writer looking to launch your career and build your portfolio or you are an experienced writer looking to break into a new field and improve your skills (while helping animals in the process), there is a spot for you at Furzly! You will be working on our sister companies' website Preferable Pups.

Who We Are: 

We’re on a mission to help pets around the world! With our sights set on becoming the most authoritative pet platform available, Furzly leads the conversation about pet health and information while still producing media that reminds us how much of a treasure animals are. How? We do this by empowering our writing community to create valuable, insightful content that can be leveraged on a global scale. Our success is dependent on having a community of writers that create stories for our educational platform.

That’s where you come in!

Who We Are Looking For: 

We understand that internships these days can be difficult to land, and the unfortunate truth about building a writing career is that you need a starting point to prove your worth and build your skillset. Fortunately, we are here to help! Here are the types of people we are looking to add to our Furzly team:

You Have a Passion for Pets: Since we are a pet site, this is a must! Our furry friends are our passion and they should be yours as well!
You Are Upbeat and Positive: Negative attitudes make for poor workplace environments (even in remote positions!). We want everyone on our team to have a great attitude when they approach their work and speak with other members of the team. If your tail is not wagging, we are not having it!
You Are Motivated to Make Every Article Your Best: There are writers who approach writing like work and there are writers who approach writing with the intent to provide their readers with value. You want every piece to be your best, and you want to make sure that it is the most authoritative on the web. You get out what you put in!
You Are Organized and Can Work With Our Editorial Team: We all have late days and messy desks, but we want you to be an individual who is highly-organized and who loves keeping track of their tasks from start to finish. This helps us get through our content strategy and provide you with the content that you want to write!
You Are Ambitious and Want to Change the World: You ask questions. You look for the details that others miss. You write copy that is compelling. Put simply, you are a go-getter who is looking to do the most!
You Are Communicative: You are always easy to connect with and have no problems asking questions to other team members. Although we are a remote team, we want people who are there when we need them and who are highly involved in the project!What We Expect From You: 

If you are the person we described above, that’s awesome! Now that we have you here, let’s talk about some of the expectations that we will have for you in this internship position.

You Are Available to Write (Ideally) Two Blog Posts Per Day: We don’t ask for much, but we do want you to be available to write (ideally) two blog posts per day. If you feel like you can do more, that’s great! However, this will be the sweet spot for us as we grow.
You Are Active on Your Phone or Computer Throughout the Day: We have to be able to contact you in case we have any questions for you or you have any questions for us. We usually communicate through Slack but will sometimes send emails or chat on the phone.
You Can Follow Directions (But Are Not Afraid to Pitch): Being able to adhere to our writer’s guidelines and match our tone is a must, but we also want you to have fun with your copy! In addition, we are always open to pitches. If you have ideas that you think would be great for the website, you are not afraid to pitch it to us!
You May Produce a Variety of Content (Deep Research, Viral Content, News Stories): Based on your initial trial article, we will assign you the content that we believe best matches your tone and experience. However, we do value those who feel brave enough to step outside of their comfort zone and tackle new projects. What You Can Expect to Gain From Working at Furzly: 

As we explained above, launching a writing career and gaining new skills is the toughest part of being a writer. While we want you to succeed here at Furzly, we also want you to succeed in your personal life. So, what can you expect Furzly to do for you?

We Give You Full Credit for Your Work: That’s right! Everything that you publish on our website features your name and internship status. If you are looking to attract potential employers, your status and published works are sure to do it!
You Get a Portfolio on Our Website: Better yet, we provide you with an online portfolio that gives you an opportunity to showcase your work, wrapped with a bow made of a photo of yourself and a nice byline to boot.
You Gain Valuable Insight Into the Writing and Editorial Process– Working on publications requires you to understand how to pitch your ideas, successfully develop your content, and establish relationships with others on your team, whether they are editorial staff or fellow writers. Here at Furzly, you gain valuable insight into the writing and editorial process that you can apply towards future positions!
We, Will, Be Adding Extra Incentives As We Grow: Once we build a solid content base, we will begin adding extra goodies like gift cards, pet bonuses, and other incentives that you can leverage your content skills to earn!

You will be working with our sister company, Preferable Pups, and your role will consist of

Emailing dog breeders
Writing Top 5 Dog Breeder Posts Example:https://preferablepups.com/4-best-miniature-dachshund-breeders-in-louisiana/
Communicating with the dog breeders to have a "Badge" installed on their website. We will assist you in this process.
Writing a 500-word article that will go on the breeder's website with a backlink to Preferable Pups.

If we still have you here and you’re interested in working with us, please reply to this post with your relevant work experience (if any), why you want to work with us, and what your favorite breed of dog or cat is.

We look forward to hearing from you!'

position: 2022 L’Oreal USA HR Summer Internship – Undergraduate
description: At L'Oréal, whether you are an intern, manager, or senior leader, **the most valuable asset we have is you.** Your unique sense of curiosity, creative mindset, and desire to innovate are what we expect you to bring with you every day. The L’Oréal USA Summer Internship Program is a **paid, 11-week experience** where you will be fully integrated into the day-to-day activities of a team while also **leading your own, individual strategic project** to discover what it is truly like to develop a career at the #1 Beauty Tech company in the world. We are committed to giving our interns the space to explore, to have full time employee responsibilities, present their own insights to senior management, and to become future leaders. At the end of the summer, you will present your project to senior leadership for the **opportunity to be considered for a full-time return offer into a Management Trainee program or a full-time role**. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so it is highly encouraged to apply soon. We encourage students of diverse backgrounds to apply, including, but not limited to race, ethnicity, gender expression, LGBTQ+, military status, and people with disabilities. **What You’ll Do:** - Own an individual project with strategic business impact that you present to senior leaders - Analyze data, identify root causes, and recommend solutions for HR related business issues - Experience hands-on HR generalist responsibilities, working with multiple HRIS and reporting systems - Follow up and solicit feedback from employees on a regular basis with a “customer service” orientation and ability to escalate issues when appropriate - Engage our teams in sharing best HR practices - Network and learn about multiple functions (Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance, R&I and Sales) - Participate in formal and informal training opportunities **The Program:** - This is a paid internship opportunity. Housing assistance is provided on an individual basis based on eligibility per our L'Oréal Relocation Policy. - All interns will be paired with a mentor and a buddy to help guide you through your internship - Professional development & social programming is an integral part of your internship experience to understand our culture. From networking events to trainings, your calendar will always be full! - There are many perks to being a summer intern, but two standout ones are access to our company store that has steep discounts on L’Oréal products and our Summer Friday program – every Friday during your internship is a half day! - Our summer internship is the primary path for consideration into L’Oréal’s full-time HR Management Trainee Program upon graduation and is based on overall performance Being a member of the L’Oréal USA Summer Internship Program, you will feel empowered to contribute in tangible, meaningful ways from day one because **in an organization founded on entrepreneurism and agility, your ideas are not only heard and valued, but they are often put into implementation,** too. As the #1 Beauty Tech company in the world with over 35 international brands – CeraVe, Kiehl’s, Maybelline, and Urban Decay to name just a few – we embrace [++**diversity**++](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/loreal-usa-named-to-highest-level-of-diversity-best-practices-inclusion-index-300892650.html) **and inclusion,** [++**sustainability**++](https://www.loreal.com/en/commitments-and-responsibilities/for-the-planet/)**,** [++**innovation**++](https://gizmodo.com/loreals-newest-skincare-gadget-is-even-cooler-in-person-1840868712)**, and** [++**well-being**++](https://www.wayup.com/guide/community/loreal-2468-sponsored-helping-communities-covid-19/) in the workplace to lay the groundwork for you to be able to accomplish great things. You can explore our internship program and hear directly from our past interns at [++lorealoncampus.com++](http://file//fsusnas16/CORPNY_Recruiting/Campus%20Recruitment%20Initiatives/Campus%20Recruitment/2020-2021%20Season/Internship%20Program%20Job%20Descriptions/lorealoncampus.com). Freedom to go beyond, that’s the beauty of L’Oréal - Are you ready?

position: 2022 L’Oreal USA HR Summer Internship – Undergraduate
description: At L'Oréal, whether you are an intern, manager, or senior leader, **the most valuable asset we have is you.** Your unique sense of curiosity, creative mindset, and desire to innovate are what we expect you to bring with you every day. The L’Oréal USA Summer Internship Program is a **paid, 11-week experience** where you will be fully integrated into the day-to-day activities of a team while also **leading your own, individual strategic project** to discover what it is truly like to develop a career at the #1 Beauty Tech company in the world. We are committed to giving our interns the space to explore, to have full time employee responsibilities, present their own insights to senior management, and to become future leaders. At the end of the summer, you will present your project to senior leadership for the **opportunity to be considered for a full-time return offer into a Management Trainee program or a full-time role**. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so it is highly encouraged to apply soon. We encourage students of diverse backgrounds to apply, including, but not limited to race, ethnicity, gender expression, LGBTQ+, military status, and people with disabilities. **What You’ll Do:** - Own an individual project with strategic business impact that you present to senior leaders - Analyze data, identify root causes, and recommend solutions for HR related business issues - Experience hands-on HR generalist responsibilities, working with multiple HRIS and reporting systems - Follow up and solicit feedback from employees on a regular basis with a “customer service” orientation and ability to escalate issues when appropriate - Engage our teams in sharing best HR practices - Network and learn about multiple functions (Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance, R&I and Sales) - Participate in formal and informal training opportunities **The Program:** - This is a paid internship opportunity. Housing assistance is provided on an individual basis based on eligibility per our L'Oréal Relocation Policy. - All interns will be paired with a mentor and a buddy to help guide you through your internship - Professional development & social programming is an integral part of your internship experience to understand our culture. From networking events to trainings, your calendar will always be full! - There are many perks to being a summer intern, but two standout ones are access to our company store that has steep discounts on L’Oréal products and our Summer Friday program – every Friday during your internship is a half day! - Our summer internship is the primary path for consideration into L’Oréal’s full-time HR Management Trainee Program upon graduation and is based on overall performance Being a member of the L’Oréal USA Summer Internship Program, you will feel empowered to contribute in tangible, meaningful ways from day one because **in an organization founded on entrepreneurism and agility, your ideas are not only heard and valued, but they are often put into implementation,** too. As the #1 Beauty Tech company in the world with over 35 international brands – CeraVe, Kiehl’s, Maybelline, and Urban Decay to name just a few – we embrace [++**diversity**++](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/loreal-usa-named-to-highest-level-of-diversity-best-practices-inclusion-index-300892650.html) **and inclusion,** [++**sustainability**++](https://www.loreal.com/en/commitments-and-responsibilities/for-the-planet/)**,** [++**innovation**++](https://gizmodo.com/loreals-newest-skincare-gadget-is-even-cooler-in-person-1840868712)**, and** [++**well-being**++](https://www.wayup.com/guide/community/loreal-2468-sponsored-helping-communities-covid-19/) in the workplace to lay the groundwork for you to be able to accomplish great things. You can explore our internship program and hear directly from our past interns at [++lorealoncampus.com++](http://file//fsusnas16/CORPNY_Recruiting/Campus%20Recruitment%20Initiatives/Campus%20Recruitment/2020-2021%20Season/Internship%20Program%20Job%20Descriptions/lorealoncampus.com). position: 2022 L’Oréal USA Finance Summer Internship – Undergraduate
description: At L'Oréal, whether you are an intern, manager, or senior leader, **the most valuable asset we have is you.** Your unique sense of curiosity, creative mindset, and desire to innovate are what we expect you to bring with you every day. The L’Oréal USA Summer Internship Program is a **paid, 11-week experience** where you will be fully integrated into the day-to-day activities of a team while also **leading your own, individual strategic project** to discover what it is truly like to develop a career at the #1 Beauty Tech company in the world. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so it is highly encouraged to apply soon. We encourage students of diverse backgrounds to apply, including, but not limited to race, ethnicity, gender expression, LGBTQ+, military status, and people with disabilities. **What You’ll Do:** - Dive into the world of finance through day-to-day tasks like category analysis, process improvement, systems enhancement, and more - Generate and analyze financial data using a variety of systems to recommend profitable business strategies for L’Oréal brands - Monitor actual business results vs. budgets, trends, and forecasts - Evaluate the ROI of strategic business decisions to effectively manage brand Profit & Loss statements - Provide financial support across functions like Marketing, Sales, Operations, and Manufacturing - Own an individual project and/or group project with strategic business impact that you present to senior leaders **The Program:** - This is a paid internship opportunity. Housing assistance is provided on an individual basis based on eligibility per our L'Oréal Relocation Policy. - You will be placed onto a team within one of the three areas of finance: - Brand or commercial profit and loss (P&L) management and analysis involving interaction with various functional areas such as Marketing, Sales, Operations, and Purchasing - Overall L’Oréal USA financial consolidation, reporting, and analysis involving interaction with various US divisions and Paris headquarters - Manufacturing, Supply Chain or Corporate Operations rotation providing financial analysis, consolidation and strategic support for production and distribution in the U.S. - All interns will be paired with a mentor and a buddy to help guide you through your internship - Professional development & social programming is an integral part of your internship experience to understand our culture. position: Health coach to Host Online Meetings
description:
We are looking for someone to lead group sessions in an emotional wellness program. We will provide all training material to the candidate. The program includes maximum of 10 participants who want to improve their emotional wellness. They have to go through a 12-week program, part of which are the weekly group meetings. All the content that will be delivered is developed from us. What we require from you:

Learning the content prior to the session
Scheduling the sessions
Meeting with each group for 1 hour for 12 weeks
Delivering the content effectively
Engaging all group members and creating a non-judgmental environment for them to open up
Build group cohesion and trust with group members quickly
Be friendly, extravert, enthusiastic
Psychology students/grads preferred
Previous experience in peer support groups/group leading sessions is a plus but not required

*This is a remote position.

Program Objective: Our internship program is designed as an educational program to provide our interns with the opportunity to learn about growing a brand in the Country music industry while gaining work experience. Participants in this program will receive hands-on experience managing a variety of different editorial assignments and optimizing for social media on every relevant platform. Interns will build skills and make connections that will give them a great foundation for a career in the media industry.

Contributing Writer Intern Responsibilities (multiple positions available- responsibilities will vary based on your role):

- Writing and publishing original, high-quality 200+ word pieces for our website.

- Fact-checking

- Article research

- Ensuring up-to-date content with breaking news, new music releases, and other relevant industry information.

- Contribute creative ideas to editorial calendar.

- Prepare weekly and monthly reports to assist in content strategy.

- Assist in writing copy and acquiring photos for editorial and social media.

*Students with an interest in Country Music are encouraged to apply*

Qualifications: This is an unpaid internship. All interns must be college students and receive college credits for their internship. College students must get prior approval from their school/academic advisor confirming that they will receive school credit for the internship. School credit confirmation must be presented prior to beginning the internship. Interns must be at least 18 years of age.

Opportunities: Internships are available year-round. Internships usually vary from 15-20 hours per week. Specific days and times will be agreed upon in advance.

We're committed to building a diverse and inclusive team that's representative of our community.

**Join the Team @ Kraft Heinz** Hello! We’re Kraft Heinz - one of the world’s most recognized brands as one of the **largest food and beverage companies in the world**. For 150 years, Kraft Heinz has produced some of the world's most beloved products. We are one of the largest global food and beverage companies, with a portfolio that is a diverse mix of iconic and emerging brands. As the guardians of these brands and the creators of innovative products, we're dedicated to the sustainable health of our people and our planet. Each year, we hire students and recent graduate for two programs: 1. **Entry-Level Trainee Program:** A 10-month immersive program for recent graduates aimed to develop you into a future leader of our company. Get the opportunity to travel to all areas of our organization and see exactly how the Mac and Cheese get made - as well as multiple opportunities to work directly in our business. After learning the ins and outs of the CPG industry and Kraft Heinz, you'll start rotations that provide real-world experience in our corporate office and within one of our many field sales offices, plant facilities, or R&D centers. All of which sets you up for success once you start your full-time role with our company. 2. **Summer Internships:** As a Kraft Heinz Intern, you’ll join a class of other ambitious interns to learn directly from Kraft Heinz leaders. You’ll be immersed in weekly learning opportunities and social experiences as well as delivering tangible business results in your role. Our internship program is designed to shape your emerging talent and provide you with real-world experience. Interested in these opportunities? Submit your interest now to let us know that you want to join Kraft Heinz! You’ll be the first to know when applications open.

Role:  Assist in the implementation of the annual development,fundraising programs and marketing for the Cleveland Minority Organ Tissue Transplant Education Program (MOTTEP) working with the Executive Director Development and Special Event Committees and Volunteers. This position reports to the Executive Director.

We at Teen Cancer America firmly believe we all grow when we work together. That belief shapes how we view cancer care, how we accomplish change, and how we operate as an organization. Our internship program holds that belief at its very core and it shows in our individual roles.

No two people are exactly alike and therefore the interests, goals, and needs of each person are unique. We don’t just accept that, we prefer it. Our internship is designed to be flexible to better meet the needs of each individual intern in the rapidly changing philanthropic world. We value open and honest communication as the basis by which a positive working relationship can be established. Through cooperation, we hope that we will both benefit from your time in this role.

Teen Cancer America works directly with hospitals and healthcare providers to understand the needs and nuances of adolescent and young adult (AYA) cancer care. We help them develop age-specific programs that restructure the health system to best support this currently underserved population. This particular internship is perfect for people with an interest in social media management, communication, and marketing. It is also really valuable for anyone with a personal relationship to AYA cancer.

The Digital Marketing and Communications Intern works closely with our Marketing and Communications team to further the reach of our message primarily through our social media, website, and newsletter. Throughout the course of our internship, you will also be given the opportunity to work on your own individual project with our support. You will be asked to think creatively, engage on behalf of the charity, and help manage content. The ideal candidate is a clear, direct, and timely communicator with an independent and organized workflow.

This is an entirely remote position. You do not need to work rigid hours, but you will be responsible for reporting on the progress of your work during regular meetings with our Marketing and Communications team as well as the Intern Program lead. We ask that you give us an estimate about the average time you will spend working on this internship each week and your end date, if you have one, so we can make sure you are assigned projects within your scope. We are looking for a committed intern that is willing to give at least 3 hours a week for at least three months.

All our interns also have access to our Professional Development Program. This program is specifically designed to help interns create and receive feedback on resumes, learn and practice writing cover letters and strategies for job interviews. The Professional Development Program is not required for any intern and you can choose to do just the parts of the program you feel are most helpful. The full course takes between six and eight sessions to complete including a mock job interview.

You must fill out the application here to apply: https://www.tfaforms.com/4947747

Internship Duties include:

Collaborate with the communication and hospitals teams to create social, website and newsletter copy
Monitor analytics to identify viable ideas, trends and growth patterns
Create content and brainstorm ideas for campaigns
Access and monitor social media accounts, trends, and news
Engage with the cancer community on social media to generate traffic
Find and follow community cancer organizations and save their details
Report on trends in the field of social media
Upload content to YouTube
Cut existing content to fit Snapchat, Instagram Reels, and TikTok formats
Create at least one piece for The Short Current: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSyLhU3jyJrTWllm1TNADqjCYbUn5TehX
Additional communication and social media responsibilities depending on the initiatives that the fundraising, communication and marketing teams are currently working on

Requirements:

Proficient in social channels including Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, LinkedIn, YouTube, TikTok and other channels
Quick, critical thinker and problem solver
Strong writing skills
Detail-oriented and organized
Positive attitude with a cooperative approach
Clear, direct, and timely communication
Independent and self-motivated
Ability work alongside a diverse group of employees and simultaneously work toward many company initiatives at once
Entry level experience determining how to cater unique marketing campaigns to a unique audience
Entry level understanding of marketing strategy and how to use the concepts throughout various forms of outreach

Preferred Skills:

Experience with Canva, Photoshop, or other graphic design software
Google Analytics
Video editing and familiarity with the different video specifications for each platform
General knowledge of Search Engine Optimization and internet ranking for web content
